body_html:
The Bazel Presubmit is set up recently. It needs some fixes that's not included in r1.7. I believe rebase from HEAD should fix the "Bazel is not installed", because the build _tf_windowd.sh should set the correct PATH value.
…
On Tue, Apr 10, 2018, 7:43 PM Mark Daoust ***@***.***> wrote: Hi ***@***.*** I'm not sure what is causing that "Windows Bazel" build to fail. But as far as I can tell this patch is based on the current tip of r1.7: git log --oneline --graph --decorate * 8a2c840 (HEAD -> MarkDaoust-patch-1, upstream/MarkDaoust-patch-1) Capitalization. * cf65769 Add missing link to the eager guide. * 99322a9 (upstream/r1.7, r1.7) Merge pull request #18137 from annarev/update_release_notes |\ | * 57de6ef Also adding a note about Cuda supported version 99322a9 <99322a9> is the current top commit of the r1.7 branch. The test logs seem to say that bazel is not installed <https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/98ea2497-d390-42af-a3a7-6dac17d82843/targets/%2F%2Ftensorflow%2Ftools%2Fci_build%2Fbuilds:gen_win_out/log> . — You are receiving this because you commented. body_text:
The Bazel Presubmit is set up recently. It needs some fixes that's not
included in r1.7. I believe rebase from HEAD should fix the "Bazel is not
installed", because the build _tf_windowd.sh should set the correct PATH
value.
…
On Tue, Apr 10, 2018, 7:43 PM Mark Daoust ***@***.***> wrote:
 Hi ***@***.***

 I'm not sure what is causing that "Windows Bazel" build to fail. But as
 far as I can tell this patch is based on the current tip of r1.7:

 git log --oneline --graph --decorate

 * 8a2c840 (HEAD -> MarkDaoust-patch-1, upstream/MarkDaoust-patch-1) Capitalization.
 * cf65769 Add missing link to the eager guide.
 *   99322a9 (upstream/r1.7, r1.7) Merge pull request #18137 from annarev/update_release_notes
 |\
 | * 57de6ef Also adding a note about Cuda supported version

 99322a9
 <99322a9>
 is the current top commit of the r1.7 branch.

 The test logs seem to say that bazel is not installed
 <https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/98ea2497-d390-42af-a3a7-6dac17d82843/targets/%2F%2Ftensorflow%2Ftools%2Fci_build%2Fbuilds:gen_win_out/log>
 .

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.


 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#18385 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AD-nti8p1cQwDdBOx7QWzX2kNamrPAXiks5tnO9fgaJpZM4TOhjO>
 .
body:
The Bazel Presubmit is set up recently. It needs some fixes that's not
included in r1.7. I believe rebase from HEAD should fix the "Bazel is not
installed", because the build _tf_windowd.sh should set the correct PATH
value.

On Tue, Apr 10, 2018, 7:43 PM Mark Daoust <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi meteorcloudy@.
>
> I'm not sure what is causing that "Windows Bazel" build to fail. But as
> far as I can tell this patch is based on the current tip of r1.7:
>
> git log --oneline --graph --decorate
>
> * 8a2c8409c7 (HEAD -> MarkDaoust-patch-1, upstream/MarkDaoust-patch-1) Capitalization.
> * cf65769bef Add missing link to the eager guide.
> *   99322a92bf (upstream/r1.7, r1.7) Merge pull request #18137 from annarev/update_release_notes
> |\
> | * 57de6ef5b1 Also adding a note about Cuda supported version
>
> 99322a9
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/99322a92bfcc16191b7e68774d4964866c1f1fea>
> is the current top commit of the r1.7 branch.
>
> The test logs seem to say that bazel is not installed
> <https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/98ea2497-d390-42af-a3a7-6dac17d82843/targets/%2F%2Ftensorflow%2Ftools%2Fci_build%2Fbuilds:gen_win_out/log>
> .
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
>
>
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/18385#issuecomment-380187247>,
> or mute the thread
